p: For this experimental study, fresh leaves of R. albersii and C. amplifolium were collected in December 2017 from its natural habitat in Bench district, namely Temenja Yaxi and Andekel Kebele, Southwest Ethiopia, about 574 km from Addis Ababa. The leaves were covered in plastic sheet during transportation. The collected plants were then identified and authenticated as R. albersii and C. amplifolium by a taxonomist at the National Herbarium, College of Natural and Computational Sciences, Addis Ababa University, where voucher specimens (no. HE 001 and HE 002, respectively) were deposited for future reference.
